means: 换算( reduce的过去式和过去分词 )

word_mean: 复位的：回复到适当地方或位置的，例如复位的骨折
还原的：恢复至金属形式的(例如还原铁)，或因化学变化涉及电子增益而产生改变的

PerfectNetExp.abs: The former president was reduced to the status of a prisoner ., 这位前总统已沦为阶下囚.
reduced in size or pulled together ., 在尺寸上减小或者集中在一起.

the application of rational reduced order model in electromagnetic domain ., 有理降阶模型在电磁问题中的应用.

英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... productivity n 生产力，生产活动 reduce v 降低，减少 conduct n 行为；指挥.

entry.def: If you reduce something, you make it smaller in size or amount, or less in degree.

example.ex: It reduces the risks of heart disease...
example.tran: 这降低了患心脏病的风险。

example.ex: Consumption is being reduced by 25 per cent...

entry.tran: 使沦为，使陷入（不好的境地）
entry.def: If someone is reduced to a weaker or inferior state, they become weaker or inferior as a result of something that happens to them.

example.ex: They were reduced to extreme poverty...
example.tran: 他们陷入极端贫困的状态。

example.ex: They wanted the army reduced to a police force.
example.tran: 他们想把这支队伍降级为一支警察部队。

entry.tran: 迫使;使不得不（做）；使只得
entry.def: If you say that someone is reduced to doing something, you mean that they have to do it, although it is unpleasant or embarrassing.

example.ex: He was reduced to begging for a living.

entry.def: If something is changed to a different or less complicated form, you can say that it is reduced to that form.

example.ex: All the buildings in the town have been reduced to rubble...
example.tran: 城里所有的建筑都成了废墟。

example.ex: Politics has been reduced to class struggle.

entry.def: If you reduce liquid when you are cooking, or if it reduces, it is boiled in order to make it less in quantity and thicker.

example.ex: Boil the liquid in a small saucepan to reduce it by half...
example.tran: 用小炖锅炖，收一半汤汁。

entry.def: If you say that someone is living in reduced circumstances, you mean that they do not have as much money as they used to have.

example.ex: They are the descendants of emperors and kings and are now living in reduced circumstances.
example.tran: 他们是帝王的后代，但是现在境况大不如前了。

entry.def: If someone or something reduces you to silence, they make you feel so upset or confused that you cannot speak.

example.ex: Her challenge reduced them to silence.
example.tran: 她的质问让他们哑口无言。

entry.def: If someone or something reduces you to tears, they make you feel so unhappy that you cry.

example.ex: The attentions of the media reduced her to tears.
example.tran: 媒体的关注把她弄哭了。

means.word_mean: 1. made less in size or amount or degree

auth_sentence.content: The smell of the whole farm was also reduced.
auth_sentence.res_content: The smell of the whole farm was also reduced.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The smell of the whole farm was also reduced.

auth_sentence.content: Some have reduced staff, some have reduced benefits.
auth_sentence.res_content: Some have reduced staff, some have reduced benefits.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Some have reduced staff, some have reduced benefits.

auth_sentence.content: Boil liquid until reduced to about half a cup.
auth_sentence.res_content: Boil liquid until reduced to about half a cup.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Boil liquid until reduced to about half a cup.

Sentence.sentence: Printing with moveable type on paper dramatically reduced the cost of producing a book compared with the old-fashioned ones handwritten on vellum, which comes from sheepskin.
reduced his revenues to a quarter of normal years
But technology has reduced transaction costs, making sharing assets cheaper and easier than ever—and therefore possible on a much larger scale.
In addition to a 16-month leave,a Swedish parent has the right to work six hours a day (for a reduced salary)until his or her child is eight years old.
He is far less likely to take a year of parental leave and then return on a reduced work schedule for the next eight years

Colleges, for their part, have since 1985 graduated fewer chemical, mechanical, industrial and metallurgical (冶金的) engineers, partly in response to the reduced role of manufacturing, a big employer of them.
